title: GMB's Laura Tobin forced to wear bonkers hat/scarf combo as weather goes awry
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Good Morning Britain’s weather presenter Laura Tobin was given a unique new look on today’s episode – with a dashing hat/scarf combo.

Andi Peters, fresh from a trip to Mongolia, brought back a present for the star that she would live to regret as anchors Ben Shepherd and Kate Garraway forced her to wear it for her weather report.

Ruining her carefully maintained hairdo, Laura obliged as she wrapped the yards of grey scarf, that came already attached to the hat, around her neck.

‘This will come in very handy this morning because across large parts of England it is cold, and there’s a frost,’ she beamed.

Ben compared her to the new Olympic logo for Paris 2024, known as Marianne, calling for her to put on her best pout to recreate it.

Laura then came to a glaring realisation and declared: ‘Wonderful…I don’t have to wear this for the whole weather do it?’

Weather. But make it fashion. (Picture: ITV)

Things then went from bad to worse with the reporter when a technical glitch meant that her graphics failed to appear on screen, forcing her to come up with a distraction as it was fixed.

Finally, it all fell into place, but by that point Laura had to rush through a lot of the alerts.

All in a day’s work, Laura!

More: Good Morning Britain James Blunt asks Kate Garraway for kidney as he reveals father is waiting on transplant Angie Best snaps at professor delaying menopause with surgery Paul Gascoigne fights back tears recalling sexual assault allegation

Elsewhere on the show, Peter Andre was forced to defend his new role on the West End as part of jukebox musical, Thriller.

The show recreates periods of the controversial singer’s life, with Peter focusing on the Off The Wall era, and urging people to ‘keep the music separate’ from the sexual assault allegations made against Jackson.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays from 6am on ITV.
